meanings.definition: Corresponding in size, amount, or degree
meanings.sent1: The amount of sugar in the recipe is proportional to the sweetness of the dessert.
meanings.sent2: Her height is proportional to her age, as she grows taller each year.
meanings.sent3: The clown's shoes were so big that they looked proportional to his tiny car.
meanings.sent4: The student's effort was proportional to the improvement in his grades.
meanings.sent5: The number of guests at the party was directly proportional to the amount of food prepared.

meanings.definition: Having a constant ratio or relation
meanings.sent1: The gears in the machine move at a proportional speed to each other.
meanings.sent2: The ingredients in the mixture must be in a proportional ratio for the cake to rise properly.
meanings.sent3: The siblings' heights were so proportional that they often confused strangers.
meanings.sent4: The teacher explained that the sides of a square are always proportional to each other.
meanings.sent5: The artist ensured that the colors used in the painting were proportional to create balance.

meanings.definition: Distributing or allocating in proportion to something else
meanings.sent1: The charity organization is proportional in distributing resources to those in need.
meanings.sent2: The teacher will proportional the candies among the students for the game.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to proportional the spices based on the size of the dish.
meanings.sent4: The manager will proportional the budget according to the sales of each department.
meanings.sent5: The coach will proportional the playing time based on the players' performance in practice.
